Reason: The _monitor configuration option is performance-sensitive because it directly affects the behavior and size of the PersistentJournal object created in the code. The creation of the PersistentJournal object involves performance-related operations such as setting journal size thresholds, age thresholds, disk synchronization, and monitoring. These operations can have a notable impact on system performance, especially in terms of memory consumption and execution time. Therefore, the _monitor configuration is considered performance-sensitive based on its direct and substantial impact on system performance at the system level.
